definition: to sign a contract or agreement
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Getting over a hundred people to sign up for anything these days is a tough enough task.
sentences.chinese: 百餘人簽約的事情，這幾天是艱鉅的任務。

sentences.english: Eextremeccly member of the original cast am signed except her.
sentences.chinese: 除她之外的原班演員都是簽約的。

sentences.english: Chao signed with the image of cool tricks Linfair record.
sentences.chinese: 張超以帥氣花樣的形象簽約福茂唱片。

sentences.english: Summer signing Chris Smalling says he's enjoyed every minute of life so far as a Manchester United player.
sentences.chinese: 夏季簽約的斯馬林說自己熱愛在曼聯的每一分鐘。

sentences.english: Signing up with Ferrari meant rebuilding my self-confidence in my own potential.
sentences.chinese: 和法拉利簽約意味着在我的潛能中重塑自信。

sentences.english: The driver is always an independent contractor.
Italian football clubs are queuing up to sign the young star.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的足球俱樂部都搶着要與這個年輕球星簽約。

sentences.english: You'll have to sign a contract, and agree to use their serv.
sentences.chinese: 你必須和他們簽約，同意至少使用他們的服務兩年。

sentences.english: Signatories must open government contracts to foreign companies.
sentences.chinese: 簽約國必須對外國公司開放政府訂單。

sentences.english: The signing has been completed of Dutch international defender Khalid Boulahrouz.
sentences.chinese: 藍軍完成和荷蘭國腳後衛博拉魯茲的簽約儀式。

sentences.english: As you may know, I send out a “Success Tip” every Sunday to those of you who have signed-up to receive my success tips.
sentences.chinese: 我每週末發一條“成功祕訣”給那些已經簽約的人。

sentences.english: Ron Artest quickly signed with the Lakers.
sentences.chinese: 阿泰斯特很快就與湖人簽約。

sentences.english: Just before the summer window closed they squeezed in a takeover and the record-signing of Robinho.
sentences.chinese: 他們在夏季轉會窗口關閉前與羅比尼奧簽約。

sentences.english: Allows parties to keep the negotiated rate confidential.
sentences.chinese: 允許簽約方對已達成協議的運價保密。

sentences.english: any regulatory document certifying the legal status of the two parties to the contract.
sentences.chinese: 簽約雙方法律地位的證明文件。

sentences.english: The publicist they assigned to me started booking me on radio talk shows.
sentences.chinese: 和我簽約的出版商開始在廣播談話秀上給我做廣告。

definition: unit (of measure)/unit (group of people as a whole)/work unit (place of employment, esp. in the PRC prior to economic reform)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
